channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Cheap Old Houses: Buying Fixer-Uppers for Just $100K
item.description: Would you buy a house for $100K? That’s right, just twenty-five percent of the median home price in America. Well, we found a couple who does just that, finding fixer-upper […]

item.title: Meet PayHOA, a profitable and once-bootstrapped SaaS startup that just landed a $27.5M Series A
item.description: PayHOA, a previously bootstrapped Kentucky-based startup that offers software for self-managed homeowner associations (HOAs), is an example of how real-world problems can translate into opportunity. It just raised a $27.5 million Series A round in an environment where nearly $30 million Series A rounds are no longer common. PayHOA founder and CEO Mike Bollinger has […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: When Bad Cops Become Private Security Guards
item.description: There’s growing evidence that former officers with troubling histories of abuse can easily find second careers in private security.

item.title: Is Your Doctor ‘Blue Zones’ Certified?
item.description: The American College of Lifestyle Medicine and Blue Zones will soon offer a new clinical certification to physicians and health professionals.

item.title: Inside Our FIRST Commercial Real Estate Deal (A 13-Unit Hotel!)
item.description: What goes into a commercial real estate deal? You’re about to find out! Fortunately, buying one of these properties isn’t quite the jump from residential real estate as you might […]

item.title: Restaurant365 orders in $175M at $1B+ valuation to supersize its food service software stack
item.description: Restaurant365, which offers a restaurant management suite, has raised a hot $175M from ICONIQ Growth, KKR and L Catterton. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: A Rare Bright Spot for a Canine Lover Doing Time: Raising Puppies to Become Service Dogs
item.description: Adam Roberts reflects on the highs and occasional lows of training Labrador retrievers for the Puppies Behind Bars program.

item.title: Expert Q&A: Alzheimer’s Risk and the APOE4 Gene
item.description: If you have two copies of the APOE4 gene, new research suggests that you’re very likely to develop Alzheimer’s. Experts break down the findings and share what you can do to lower your risk.

item.title: Is the 1% Rule Dead? + Why Building (NOT Buying) Could Make You More
item.description: Could building houses make you more money than buying existing ones? When should someone use the 1% rule in real estate, and when does this metric point to a cash […]

item.title: Portuguese VC firm Shilling launches €50M opportunity fund to back growth-stage startups
item.description: Venture firm Shilling has launched a €50M fund to support growth-stage startups in its own portfolio and to invest in startups everywhere else. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: The Marshall Project Wins the Dart Award for “The Mercy Workers”
item.description: Our feature on mitigation specialists who help save people from the death penalty was recognized for making “significant contributions to public understanding of trauma-related issues.”

item.title: Experts Watching Bird Flu Carefully in Case It Takes Off
item.description: The virus variant that is circulating among cattle is not an efficient cause of disease in humans. There may be more concern if H5N1 passes to pigs, because their viral receptors are closer to those in humans.

item.title: The Small Business Owner’s Guide to Taxes, LLCs, Deductions, & Audit Risks
item.description: Starting your first or next business? This episode is for you. Today, we’re bringing you everything you need to know about small business taxes for beginners. Whether you’re a solo […]

item.title: LanceDB, which counts Midjourney as a customer, is building databases for multimodal AI
item.description: Chang She, previously the VP of engineering at Tubi and a Cloudera veteran, has years of experience building data tooling and infrastructure. But when She began working in the AI space, he quickly ran into problems with traditional data infrastructure — problems that prevented him from bringing AI models into production. “Machine learning engineers and […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Weinstein Ruling Poses Quandary: Can #MeToo Coexist With Protections for Defendants?
item.description: Proving sex crimes often requires evidence that is generally excluded to protect the rights of the accused.

item.title: The 7-Hour Itch: 3 Women With Eczema Describe the Ways They Combat Nighttime Flare-Ups
item.description: Three women with eczema describe how they combat nighttime flare-ups.

item.title: What Exactly Does a Property Management Company Do?
item.description: A property management company plays a vital role in overseeing the daily operations of rental properties to ensure efficient tenant management while maximizing profitability.

item.title: Berlin-based trawa raises €10M to use AI to make buying renewable energy easier for SMEs
item.description: Trawa simplifies energy purchasing and management for SMEs by leveraging an AI-powered platform and downstream data from customers. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Mississippi Lawmakers Considered Modest Public Defense Reforms. They Rejected All of Them.
item.description: With its refusal to impose oversight or consistent standards in local defense, Mississippi risks falling further behind rest of the U.S., critics say.

item.title: A Mother’s Love: The Challenges of Parenting a Child With Eczema
item.description: Two moms reveal the great lengths they went to in their determination to give their children relief and good health.
